post_title: Gallery at Abbey Hall, Eye, Suffolk, UK
post_content:
This 400sqm space has a large woodburner on each floor. Fires will be lit before guests arrive, and firewood is supplied for the duration of each stay. There is also an electric radiator in the bedroom and a heated towel rail in the shower room. There are cashmere blankets and sheepskins to snuggle up with in front of the fire.

The bedroom has a comfy king-sized bed with finest bedlinen with an en-suite shower room and a separate toilet, divided from the gallery by huge hessian and silk curtains. A pair of socks is provided as an arrival gift, and there are robes, hairdryer and hot water bottles for guest use, as well as wonderful large White Company towels.

A fridge, hotplates, oven, kettle, crockery etc, all cooking facilities are located in the large workshop. There is wifi throughout the Gallery and a stereo system.

The owners will fill the fridge for the guests with organic eggs, local bacon, home-baked bread, butter, jams, coffee, tea and milk. They can cook for themselves, but alternatively candlelit dinners cooked by a local caterer can be arranged at extra cost. The owners are also happy to help with reservations at good local restaurants or pubs.

The shepherds hut in the grounds sleeps a further two guests, for a maximum of four guests. There is s stove, but guests have to share the shower room.

 

AROUND  

This vacation home rental in Suffolk is located on the edge of the historic village of Eye, which has a bakery, deli, butcher and cafés, as well as antique shops and a small castle. There is a market every Wednesday morning, and a small farmers market every Friday morning with fresh locally-caught fish and farm produce. There are several pubs and restaurants nearby, including The Fox and Goose at Fressingfield and The Swan Inn at Hoxne.   

Attractions within easy reach include Bressingham Gardens and Steam Museum, the coast at Southwold and Walberswick, and Minsmere nature reserve. The cities of Norwich, Bury St Edmunds and Ipswich are all about 30 minutes drive. For those who like to sail, the Norfolk Broads or the estuary of the River Deben are nearby.  

 

LOCATION  

Eye, Suffolk, England, UK. Nearest airport: London Stansted (1.5 hours by car). There is a railway station in nearby Diss, with links to London Liverpool Street every 30 minutes.  

 

BEST TIME TO VISIT  

England is beautiful all year round, but the weather is best from spring to autumn.

headline: A Gallery Living Space in the English Countryside
what_we_like_title: A Spacious, Self-Indulgent Sanctuary with Shoppable Art
what-we-like:
This stunning property was once home to a group of Benedictine monks, who founded a priory here in the 11th century. It felt into ruin in 1537, and the remains were turned into farm buildings.

In 2006, a fashion stylist and her art director husband discovered the rundown property and turned it into a contemporary holiday letting that makes the very best of its original features. Set in the Suffolk countryside, it's within walking distance of the historic village of Eye.

The newest addition to the site, this is a huge gallery living space with an eclectic mix of mid-century Scandinavian and one-off pieces, and art throughout that is all available for sale. The Gallery sleeps two, but space for two additional guests is available in the nearby shepherds hut (at extra cost).

This vacation home rental in Suffolk is ideal for two people who love the countryside but want style and space, less than two hours away from London by car.

To see the other property on this site, visit Priory Grounds here.

219017.comment_content:
The Gallery at Abbey Hall is a unique and magical place to stay. This converted barn is an impressive space, with history in its stones. Especially now, when everyone is stuck inside, it gives an extraordinary sense of airiness and light, and the opportunity to feel liberated. A huge wood burning stove adds to the atmosphere and keeps the place warm, though there are also other heaters. The downstairs area offers really grand dining while upstairs is for relaxing. It's nice to be in the gallery surrounded by art - and the bedroom area is really cozy. The space has been cleverly converted so there are different areas - a lounge, a breakfast nook and a bedroom. There are - luxury - two loos and a great shower. The locality nearby is charming, a proper little town with great walks. It's not a conventional choice for bed and breakfast. Instead it's a place to inspire, somewhere wonderful to think, chill out, read, or work. We loved it!

Writer & Art Critic

post_title: Events at Abbey Hall, Eye, Suffolk, England
post_content:
Set within ten acres of water meadows, near the Suffolk village of Eye, this beautiful designer-created estate is a unique and historic location for special events. 

Composed of a cluster of buildings, the former farm structures have been repurposed and redesigned with a sharp contemporary make-over. The interiors are flooded with natural light, and feature vaulted ceilings with exposed wooden beams and skylights, poured concrete and oak floors, original brickwork, and large windows that open onto landscaped gardens.

The large open-plan living area has a great mid-century feel, with vintage furniture, a wood-burning stove, large dining area and fully-equipped kitchen with catering services available for large and small events.  

The house also has great eco sensibilities, using as many recycled materials as possible, ground source space and water heating as well as solar photovoltaics, earning it a rare A-grade EPC rating. 

Fully staffed with customized catering and event services available, the property is equipped to accommodate on site events of up to one hundred guests and up to six overnight guests.

Adjacent to the river Dove and beyond to the magnificent Church of St Peter and St Paul, the landscape is a tranquil example of the English Picturesque.

Directly on the ancient Michael and Mary ley line, which runs from the Suffolk coast to Glastonbury and St Michael's Mount, the property's spiritual peace is complemented by the most amazing sunsets and a lovely idyll for your special event.

 

LOCATION

Eye, Suffolk, England. Nearest Airport: All London Airports (2 hrs)

ms_facts_notes_descr:
About:
Olivia Pomp and Gary Rowland are the owners of Abbey Hall. We have worked for 10 years to establish a vibrant and unique space where we can live, work and create site-specific and one off events.

History

Abbey Hall is on the site of the former Benedictine Priory of St Peter built in 1011. The former Abbey Farm Barn was Listed at Risk in 1974 and has been under the watchful eye of English Heritage and Suffolk Archaeology. The Barn was used as a working dairy, then livestock farm until falling into disuse, when we bought it and proposed the development of the house and reviving the "Barn" as an open space for events and exhibitions.

We worked with local builders James Newstead and Julian White to create the house and barn. For more than 5 years we worked together to form a unique understanding of what we wanted and what was achievable - and we are still friends!

Following many years of careful navigation of heritage, archaeology and building control, we have successfully restored the buildings to create a unique place that breathes through 1000 years.

Space

Abbey Hall is a Scheduled Ancient Monument and we have worked closely with English Heritage to repair and revive the original Bake and Brew house built in 1583.

We have respected the original building and materials and applied new ideas and techniques to create a mesmerizing mixture of old and new, which exudes the romantic values of the site and has a cool and modern sense of purpose.
Our kitchen workshop is equipped with electrical, fire and water services and provides a flexible space for caterers to create their magical menus. We have an optional catering tent for gas cooking.

Events

Abbey Hall is the perfect location for a special event - birthdays, weddings, dance, music, drama or just socialising.

The acoustic is excellent and we have hosted many intimate concerts with harpsichord, piano or reggae. Seating space is 85 and standing 120.

Seating for dining is optimum 80-100, and we have a fantastic local caterer - Julie Abbs - who can work with us to staff, prepare and serve delicious food and wines. We also work with local hire companies for any special equipment or services required.

We have produced photoshoots, fashion shows, ballet festivals, music evenings, charity events, weddings and corporate functions and all have different and exciting challenges.

Terence Blacker and Louis de Bernieres performing their hilarious double act in a candlelit Abbey Hall

Weddings

Weddings at Abbey Hall are always memorable. We have the space to create the mood you are looking for - from rural charm to rustic cool.

There is no limit to the imaginative format of your wedding:
across the meadows is our beautiful church, there is the historic castle and the Town Hall is licensed for civil weddings, or perhaps under the glorious oak tree behind the Hall.

Together with our favourite caterers, we can provide unique ingredients to make the day go to plan.

Location

Abbey Hall is situated on the site of a c11 Priory on the outskirts of the beautiful market town of Eye, Suffolk.

Set in 10 acres of water meadows leading to the river Dove and beyond to the magnificent Church of St Peter and St Paul, the landscape is a tranquil example of the English Picturesque.

We are directly on the ancient Michael and Mary ley line, which runs from the Suffolk coast to Glastonbury and St Michael's Mount, so the spiritual peace is complemented by the most amazing sunsets.

The historic town of Eye is a thriving market town with a great pub, post office, bank, butchers and all the shops you need. There are lots of options for accommodation nearby and transport links are good for roads or rail. Diss is 3 miles away, with 1.5 hour links to London Liverpool Street. We are just off the A140 20 miles from both Ipswich and Norwich.

Located in the Suffolk countryside within walking distance of the historic village of Eye, this remarkable estate was once the home to a group of Benedictine monks, who founded a priory here in the 11th century. Falling into ruin in 1537, the remains were eventually turned into farm buildings before a fashion stylist and her art director husband discovered the rundown property and restored it with a dramatic contemporary update.

Surrounded by wild meadows and formal gardens, the property is an elegant and unforgettable setting for special events.

post_title: Priory Grounds, Eye, Suffolk, England, UK
post_content:
This beautiful designer-created cluster of buildings is set in ten acres of water meadows, near the Suffolk village of Eye. We love its open spaces flooded with natural light, vaulted ceilings with exposed wooden beams and skylights, poured concrete and oak floors, original brickwork, and large windows that open onto landscaped gardens.

Apparently we're not the only ones, as this holiday letting has been featured in quite a few fashion shoots. The large open-plan living area has a great mid-century feel, with vintage furniture, a wood-burning stove, large dining area and fully-equipped kitchen. There is one twin bedroom on the ground floor, a master bedroom on the first floor, with a balcony overlooking the garden, and a further double room next to it.  

The house has great eco sensibilities, using as many recycled materials as possible, ground source space and water heating as well as solar photovoltaics, earning it a rare A-grade EPC rating. There is also a swimming pond in the gardens.

 

ADDITIONAL FEATURES  

There is underfloor heating and a wood-burning stove, an LG TV, flat-screen Sony TV with DVD player, HiFi, integrated dishwasher, fridge/freezer and 4-ring electric hob/oven. A washing machine and dryer are available. 100% cotton bedlinen and towels are provided, as are bicycles and wellington boots.  

There is a vegetable garden which guests are welcome to use, and there is space in the grounds for private parking. There are two caravans in the gardens that can be used by guests, one of which has a double bed.  

There is also an event space for up to 150 guests,

 

AROUND  

The house is located on the edge of the historic village of Eye, which has a bakery, deli, butcher and cafés, as well as antique shops and a small castle. There is a market every Wednesday morning, and a small farmers market every Friday morning with fresh locally-caught fish and farm produce. There are several pubs and restaurants nearby, including The Fox and Goose at Fressingfield and The Swan Inn at Hoxne.   

Attractions within easy reach include Bressingham Gardens and Steam Museum, the coast at Southwold and Walberswick, and Minsmere nature reserve. The cities of Norwich, Bury St Edmunds and Ipswich are all about 30 minutes drive. For those who like to sail, the Norfolk Broads or the estuary of the River Deben are nearby.  

 

LOCATION  

Eye, Suffolk, England, UK. Nearest airport: London Stansted (1.5 hours by car). There is a railway station in nearby Diss, with links to London Liverpool Street every 30 minutes.  

 

BEST TIME TO VISIT  

England is beautiful all year round, but the weather is best from spring to autumn.

The presentation agreement will start on 05/11/2016 and will be in force until one of us terminates it in writing and all outstanding debts are cleared.

Boutique Homes agrees to provide a presentation of the property on boutique-homes.com and its partner sites in exchange for a 10% commission on every booking (excluding taxes/fees) of the property that is initiated through boutique-homes.com.

If not otherwise stated, there is an $80 USD listing creation fee.

Due to the partner agreement being a commission based agreement, we require the following;

1. All communication between owner and client will be performed on our conversation page until client agrees to book. Olivia Pomp will be notified via email when an inquiry is made at which point it is their responsibility to login to their boutique-homes.com control panel and respond back to any inquiries promptly.

2. We reserve the right to remove or filter messages which contain phone #s, email addresses or links to third-party sites. All contact information is released after a client is ‘ready to book’ and Olivia Pomp accepts the reservation.

3. It is expressly forbidden to use our website to promote your property with the intent to circumvent the commission fees normally due to us.

4. You hereby grant Boutique Homes a non-exclusive license to publish, in either original or modified format, any and all photographs that you upload, submit, or otherwise provide Boutique Homes. You represent and warrant (1) that you are the owner of the copyrights for any and all such photographs, and (2) that your grant of a license to Boutique Homes does not violate any third party’s rights.

You agree to defend and indemnify Boutique Homes for any action or claim arising out of any breach of your obligations, representations, or warranties in this agreement.

You agree to indemnify and hold Boutique Homes harmless from any liability for personal injury or property damage resulting from Guests or parties who reserve your property through boutique-homes.com.

5. It is understood that we are a curated website, and not a listing website where property owners can upload their own descriptions and images. If your property is accepted into our collection, we will be responsible for and have final approval of your property display on our website. We will choose the format, create the property description and select/edit the images that we deem appropriate and that fits our aesthetic standard. We will confirm the fundamental details of the property with the owner and will solicit their assistance when we feel it is necessary. It is our objective to present an accurate and factual description of each property as well as present it in a style and manner which best depicts the property and also fits within the design standards of boutique-homes.com.

6. Assuming there is availability, you should quote the total official price and any additional costs for the whole stay in the provided quote box.

7. For our commission payment you will take full payment direct from the client as per your normal methods and we will forward you a PayPal invoice, listing the commission on the booking through our website. Commission is due at the beginning of each client occupancy period and payment in your local currency is due 10 days after the invoice being sent.

8. Any fees if applicable (ex. setup fee, member fee, commission), must be paid via PayPal and agreement signed by Olivia Pomp before listing is accepted and published on boutique-homes.com.

9. You are responsible for complying with local fire, safety and licensing regulations.

10. Membership includes:

• Setup of webpage

• Up to 24 high resolution images on our website.

• Search inclusion by style, location, country

• We will promote your property via our various social media outlets, blogs, and newsletter. It will be at Boutique Home’s discretion as to when and how your property will be promoted.

notes-BH:
There is a large stone barn on the grounds, with high ceilings, original internal brick walls, simple wooden floors and a mezzanine floor. Events such as weddings and yoga retreats are possible on request.

A chef and housekeeper are available on request.
kid_friendly_description: No children 1-12 years old. Newborn babies to 1-year-olds are allowed, and children over 12 are welcome.
what-we-like:
This stunning property was once home to a group of Benedictine monks, who founded a priory here in the 11th century. It felt into ruin in 1537, and the remains were turned into farm buildings.

In 2006, a fashion stylist and her art director husband discovered the rundown property and turned it into a contemporary holiday letting that makes the very best of its original features. Set in the Suffolk countryside, it's within walking distance of the historic village of Eye, and within easy reach of London by train.

There is an additional gallery living space on the site that sleeps two guests. Click here for further information. The property also has a Benedictine Hall that can host parties and weddings for up to 150 guests. Please inquire for further details.

Rates start at those listed below. Please check with owner for exact rates.
There is a large stone barn on the grounds, with high ceilings, original internal brick walls, simple wooden floors and a mezzanine floor. Events such as weddings and yoga retreats are possible on request.
A chef and housekeeper are available on request.
house_rules: No children 1-12 years old. Newborn babies to 1-year-olds are allowed, and children over 12 are welcome.

175008.message: Hi There - I\'m emailing to enquire about booking your house for a wedding in 2019. Could you tell me the price for a wedding hire, capacity and how other people have used the space for weddings & events before? Thanks Alice
175008.edited_message: Hi There - I\'m emailing to enquire about booking your house for a wedding in 2019. Could you tell me the price for a wedding hire, capacity and how other people have used the space for weddings & events before? Thanks Alice

175021.message: Dear Alice , Thank you for your enquiry, we have had wonderful [removed] ce , many more pictures on our website. The 15th century Hall with a Showerroom and 4 toilets sits 110 on the ground floor , there is a wonderful open gallery upstairs that you could sit more people , usually it\'s being used for a drinks reception - you can have up to 150 people for a party. You can use the courtyard and our grounds for your celebration too. There is ample parking for all your guests . We work with fantastic caterers that will work with you to create the menue that you love. We have a big catering space. You can provide your own alcohol, we do not charge corkage . We can also recopmmend incredible florists, make up artists, musicians etc that we work with a lot and that will make your wedding day unique, effortless and enjoyable. EYe has a great town hall with a registry office that is very special or you could get married on top of the castle ruin, both a short walk from us. A lot of couples create their own ceremonies in Abbey Hall, with friends and family and a celebrant - Or they just have a blessing at Abbey Hall. There are many hotels/B&bs and wonderful houses to rent locally to accommodate your guests . Or we can arrange tipees in our meadow for your guests enjoy glamping. The basic Hall Hire for a Friday set up, Saturday all day wedding until 12.00 pm - Sunday clear up is Â£10000 Feel free to call me to arrange a visit to see the site, With kindest regards, Olivia Pomp tel [removed]
175021.edited_message:
